TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit DataGridItem extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.TableRow implements class System.Web.UI.IDataItemContainer, class System.Web.UI.INamingContainer

Docs.summary: Represents an item (row) in a control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A DataGridItem object represents an item (row) in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control, such as a heading section, a footer section, or a data row.
The data items of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control are stored in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItemCollection> collection that can be accessed by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.Items%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
You can use a DataGridItem object to programmatically access the properties of an item in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use a DataGridItem object to display the contents of each data item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
> [!NOTE] > The following code example uses the single-file code model and might not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code example must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information on the Web Forms code model, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
[!code-cs[DataGridItemDataBound#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_149_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[DataGridItemDataBound#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_149_1.aspx)]

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 itemIndex, int32 dataSetIndex, valuetype System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListItemType itemType) cil managed

Docs.param: The index of the item from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.Items%2A> collection in the control.
The index number of the item, from the bound data source, that appears in the control.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem> class.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem> class.
[!code-cs[Classic DataGridItem.DataGridItem Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/6d2ff38b-5f4b-4fa3-af91-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[Classic DataGridItem.DataGridItem Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/6d2ff38b-5f4b-4fa3-af91-_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual object DataItem { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the data item represented by the object in the control.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Object?displayProperty=fullName> that represents a data item in the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the DataItem property to specify or determine the properties of a data item represented by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem> object in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
> [!NOTE] > This property applies only to data items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem.ItemType%2A> property must be set to `ListItemType.Item`, `ListItemType.AlternatingItem`, `ListItemType.SelectedItem`, or `ListItemType.EditItem`.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the DataItem property to display the contents of the data items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
> [!NOTE] > The following code example uses the single-file code model and might not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code example must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension.
[!code-vb[Classic DataGridItem.DataItem Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_841_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[Classic DataGridItem.DataItem Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_841_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets the index of the object from the bound data source.
Docs.value: The index of the from the bound data source.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the DataSetIndex property to get the index of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem> object from the bound data source.
> [!NOTE] > This property applies only to data items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem.ItemType%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem> object must be set to `ListItemType.Item`, `ListItemType.AlternatingItem`, `ListItemType.SelectedItem`, or `ListItemType.EditItem`.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the DataSetIndex property to display the index of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem> object from the bound data source.
> [!NOTE] > The following code example uses the single-file code model and might not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code example must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension.
[!code-cs[Classic DataGridItem.DataSetIndex Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_930_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[Classic DataGridItem.DataSetIndex Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_930_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets the index of the object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.Items%2A> collection of the control.
Docs.value: The index of the from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.Items%2A> collection of the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the ItemIndex property to determine the index of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.Items%2A> collection of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
> [!NOTE] > This property applies only to data items in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control. The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem.ItemType%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem> object must be set to `ListItemType.Item`, `ListItemType.AlternatingItem`, `ListItemType.SelectedItem`, or `ListItemType.EditItem`.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the ItemIndex property to display the index of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGridItem> object from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid.Items%2A> collection of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.
> [!NOTE] > The following code example uses the single-file code model and might not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code example must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information on the Web Forms code model, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
[!code-vb[Classic DataGridItem.ItemIndex Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_659_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[Classic DataGridItem.ItemIndex Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_659_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets the type of the item represented by the object in the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the ItemType property to determine the type of an item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control. The following table lists the various item types.
|Item Type|Description| |---------------|-----------------| |`Header`|The heading section of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.| |`Footer`|The footer section of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.| |`Item`|An item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.| |`AlternatingItem`|An alternating item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.| |`SelectedItem`|The selected item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.| |`EditItem`|The item selected for editing in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.| |`Separator`|A separator between the items of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.| |`Pager`|The page selection section of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control.|
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the ItemType property to determine the type of an item in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control. The order in which items are created in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DataGrid> control is displayed along with the item type.
> [!NOTE] > The following code example uses the single-file code model and might not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code example must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information on the Web Forms code model, see [NIB: Events and Delegates](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/d98fd58b-fa4f-4598-8378-addf4355a115).
[!code-cs[DataGridItemDataBound#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_357_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[DataGridItemDataBound#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.webcontr_357_1.aspx)]
